text:
In this video, you’ll see how to complete the AWS 
Marketplace Vendor Insights self-assessment.

Working in AWS Audit Manager, you’ll 
learn how to locate the Vendor Insights

self-assessment, add audit owner 
permissions, and record responses for controls

Vendor Insights lets AWS Marketplace
sellers offer buyers on-demand access

to security and compliance 
information for their SaaS solutions.

For demonstration purposes, we have 
already deployed Vendor Insights in our AWS

accounts and completed the prerequisites 
for creating a Vendor Insights profile.

To get started, let’s navigate 
to AWS Audit Manager.
Let’s go to the Assessments page.

These two assessments were set up 
when Vendor Insights was onboarded.

The first assessment automatically 
captures evidence from our live

production environment 
and shared audit reports.
The second is a manual self-assessment.
Let’s open it.

Vendor Insights gathers evidence-based
 information about 140 security controls.

The self-assessment pertains to controls 
not evaluated by the automated assessment.

The Audit owners tab shows the AWS 
Identity and Access Management

(AWS IAM) roles that can access 
the controls in AWS Audit Manager.

Before reviewing the controls, we'll need to 
add our IAM user account as an audit owner.
Let’s see how to do this.
At the top of the page, select Edit.

Without making changes to the 
assessment itself, quickly advance
through the first three steps.

Step 4 shows a list of 
possible audit owners.

We'll search for our 
account and select it.
Now let’s save our changes.

The assessment has been successfully 
updated with the new audit owner.
Now let’s access the controls.

The controls are grouped 
into control sets.

Let’s expand the Access Management 
control set and drill down into a control.

The control details include its full name,
a description, and testing information.
This control asks if password

authentication is enabled to 
access the production environment.

Once we're ready to answer the 
question, we can upload supporting

evidence here, and provide a 
response on the Comments tab.

All responses should begin 
with a simple yes or no.
This enables Vendor Insights to display

the right compliance status 
in the buyer-facing dashboard.
We can then provide additional context.
Let’s go back to the assessment.

Approximately 30 controls 
are mandatory to complete.

The number of additional controls that 
need to be answered is determined by

the documentation provided, 
such as ISO or SOC 2 reports.

Let’s do a search to find out 
which controls are required.

Mandatory controls have “requires 
manual attestation” in their name.

You've just seen how to complete the AWS 
Marketplace Vendor Insights self-assessment.

You can learn more about this topic in 
the description and links for this video.
Thanks for watching. Now it's your turn to try.
